## Add Implementation to Registry

Use this template when adding a new implementation to the Bitcoin Commons implementations registry.

### Implementation Details

- **Name**: [Your implementation name]
- **Description**: [Brief 1-2 sentence description]
- **Website**: [Full URL to your website]
- **Downloads**: [Full URL to downloads page or #download anchor]
- **GitHub**: [Full URL to GitHub org/repo]
- **Verified**: [ ] Yes (I've verified this implementation uses Bitcoin Commons) / [ ] No (pending verification)

### Checklist

- [ ] I've read [IMPLEMENTATIONS_REGISTRY.md](../IMPLEMENTATIONS_REGISTRY.md)
- [ ] All required fields are filled in
- [ ] URLs are valid and accessible
- [ ] Description is under 500 characters
- [ ] Name is under 100 characters
- [ ] This implementation actually uses the Bitcoin Commons framework
- [ ] I've verified there are no duplicate entries (checked existing implementations)

### Verification Evidence (if verified=true)

If you're marking this as verified, please provide brief evidence:
- [ ] Links to governance configuration files
- [ ] References to Commons documentation in your repo
- [ ] Evidence of using Commons governance model

---

**Note**: Automated validation will run on this PR. If validation passes, this PR will be merged automatically (or with minimal review).
